pgTitle: List of fictional universes in literature

rows.text: The setting for an epic future history series extending from the 21st century out into the far future. It consists of 27 science fiction novels along with a series of seven short story anthologies and a few other miscellaneous works.

Featured in the series of novels known as the "Chronicles of Barsetshire". The county town and cathedral town is Barchester. Other towns mentioned in the novels include Silverbridge, Hogglestock and Greshamsbury.
Utopian community in the Pacific Ocean that focuses on scientific discovery
an idealized English country estate (with nearby village) and seat of the Threepwood family
Boxen: The Imaginary World of the Young C. S. Lewis
Dinotopia: A Land Apart from Time
Lost land in which humans coexist with sapient dinosaurs.
A vast, alternate dimension that can be entered via dreams.
Fantasy realm consisting of an archipelago of islands in a vast ocean that forms the setting for six books and seven short stories.
Fantasy realm that combines alien technology with magic
Feaudal galactic society in the far future
Hostile alien planet of telepathic flora and fauna
Flatland: A Romance of Many Dimensions
Authoritatarian 2-dimensional world inhabited by sentient geometric shapes ignorant of the "higher dimensions" of up and down.
Centres around the descendants of a ship lost in transit from Earth en route to found a new space station.
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
Currently consists of two science fiction novels (Hammerfall and Forge of Heaven).
Alternate world hit by a comet that forms the setting for a series of post-apocalyptic novels
Low-gravity forest planet inhabited by an arboreal culture
Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
The date of the setting is several thousand years into the future, during a time when human space colonization has filled much of the local spiral arm of the galaxy.
Future interstellar setting in which humans have been genetically altered to cope with various alien environments.
Invented by Asimov for other science fiction writers to use.
Interstellar region inhabited by a future humanity. Created by Niven for him and other writers to use.
Setting for an ongoing series of science fiction stories.
Science fiction multiverse inflused with Christian religious themes
World of Malazan Book of the Fallen
The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
A perpetually war-torn socialist world ruled by super-states.
Peter Pan, or The Boy Who Wouldn't Grow Up
An island comprising the imagination of a child
Used as the setting for a number of novels and stories which follow the fictional history of humans from roughly 2200 to 40,000 AD.
"Afterlife" in which every human who ever lived is continuously reincarnated beside a seemingly endless river.
World infused with magic created for the 30+ volume Valdemar Saga
City set in a wasteland dying Earth amid the ruins of civilisation. Setting for a number of stories.
Midnight at the Well of Souls
World consisting of 1560 hexagonal regions, each with its own climate and ecosystem
Complex fictional mythology blending gnosticism, kabbalism and various forms of pre-Christian paganism
High-fantasy setting ruled by magic-using women
World of A Song of Ice and Fire
A Song of Ice and Fire
Series of pocket universes created by an advanced, decadent humanoid race.
Parodic utopian world in which individuality and passion are sacrificed in favor of drug-induced happiness and consumerism.
Mediaeval-level future continent of Earth that forms the setting for 16 short stories.
